title: Between 1 July 2018 and 30 June 2019, will an armed group from Bangladesh engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Bangladesh?
preds: ..Slightly lowering forecast for now, mainly reflecting this question's specific stipulations.

Reports of the current regime - and associates -  suppressing dissent: https://www.hrw.org/news/2018/08/15/bangladesh-wave-arrests-over-peaceful-dissent https://www.channelnewsasia.com/news/asia/bangladesh-protests-fizzle-after-days-of-violence-10597006

Though the "fatality-count" - and other stipulations - of this question may not be reached, it currently does not appear to be an especially stable political situation in BD....heading toward planned elections later this year. https://www.yahoo.com/news/bangladesh-teens-block-roads-seventh-day-over-road-080713809.html

Slight increase to forecast in part with respect to the unresolved Rohingya refugee crisis currently affecting/involving Bangladesh. Recent reported violence in exile camps likely does not 'meet' question criteria. (First link below.) ..Attempting to incorporate (into the forecast) some potential risk (in months ahead; though probably small) for "systematic" civilian killings, in Bangladesh, particularly associated with the volatile, desperate and unresolved refugee situation. 
(FWIW, also noting that many Bangladesh refugee camps are in (relative) close proximity to Myanmar -- the state that has brutally persecuted the Rohingya. Quickly/accurately determining "responsibility" for killings inside the (large) camps might prove difficult.) https://www.reuters.com/article/us-myanmar-rohingya/killings-sow-fear-inside-rohingya-refugee-camps-in-bangladesh-idUSKBN1JU1UE https://www.reuters.com/article/us-myanmar-rohingya-un/brutal-myanmar-army-operation-aimed-at-preventing-rohingya-return-u-n-idUSKBN1CG10A https://www.aljazeera.com/news/2017/09/bangladesh-fm-violence-rohingya-genocide-170911023429604.html

..Can't find rationales offered for any of the forecasts currently listed here... Here's a quick stab at least listing some possible factors or influences for the question:  Bangladesh is expected to hold a general election later this year (2018). There appear to be questions (currently) about its legitimacy: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bangladeshi_general_election,_2018 https://www.firstpost.com/world/bangladesh-supreme-court-upholds-stay-on-khaleda-zias-bail-in-comilla-murder-case-order-wont-be-lifted-for-a-month-4648451.html http://www.atimes.com/global-spotlight-bangladeshs-upcoming-elections/ Reported (Bangladesh) "political violence statistics", perhaps indicating (at least estimated) recent numbers of such casualties: https://www.dhakatribune.com/bangladesh/2017/11/20/1028-deaths-53000-injuries/ https://politicalviolenceataglance.org/2018/02/14/violent-democracy-in-bangladesh/ 'Genocide' has occurred in the receding past in (what is now) Bangladesh: https://www.smithsonianmag.com/history/genocide-us-cant-remember-bangladesh-cant-forget-180961490/ Terrorists/terrorism exist(s) in present-day Bangladesh: https://www.lawfareblog.com/political-islam-and-islamist-terrorism-bangladesh-what-you-need-know (Initial forecast:) Quick 'read' (mainly based upon the above) is: "..will an armed group from Bangladesh engage in a campaign that systematically kills 1,000 or more civilians in Bangladesh..." seems unlikely (during the period), but not impossible. (Factual news of such a (potential) tragedy could also be difficult to obtain at least initially..) The "systematic" and "campaign" aspects - of the question - may be  particularly 'limiting' criteria.
